Posts.Content: For me, Thursday will be 5 weeks post-surgery for my robotic prostatectomy....but, I will see my surgeon tomorrow(Wednesday) for my first follow-up visit.....getting a little anxious....proud to be on the other side and feel great with everything but the leakage.
Posts.Title: It will be 6 weeks post open prostatectomy this Wednesday

Posts.Content: I'm Medicare with Humana drug plan.....was denied Cialis prescription following surgery....urologist filed an appeal for me and still was denied....dropped the issue after that.
Posts.Signature: Lloyd History: Age: 67 at time of surgery Had been doing annual DRE for 22 years with PSA's PSA: 2.41(1-4-12); 3.55(1-9-13); 4.6(9-3-13); 4.06(1-30-14); 3.4(4-30-14); 3.7(7-30-14) Biopsies: 8-26-14.....4 of 17 cores [email protected]%[email protected]% Gleason's score...3+3=6 Surgery....11-13-14....Baptist Medical Center...North Little Rock AR.....Dr. Ronald Kuhn......experience, 2000+ robotics performed. Catheter out on 6th day.....leakage still moderate with 4-5 Depends per day. Pathology report following surgery shows everything was contained within the prostate gland and Gleason's score remained 3+3=6. First PSA at 5 weeks post-surgery was 0.00......PSA at 12 weeks was 0.00....PSA at 6 months was 0.00 12 weeks----leakage better....down to most days being 1 pad.....most leakage with increase in activity but manageable.
Posts.Title: Viagra insurance issues?

Posts.Content: I checked in to one day surgery while my urologist was performing some surgeries one morning and when he finished those he did my biopsies...from what I hear most office biopsies will total usually 12......while he had me asleep he did 17 on me......I had 4 positive out of the 17, [email protected]% and [email protected]%...... later he said he was proud that's where he had me because he could have easily missed the PC had we been in the office.

Posts.Title: Did you get anesthesia during your biopsy?

Posts.Content: From the very beginning both my wife and I have been participating in prostate cancer support group meetings once a month...most every month there will be between 15 and 18 couples there with various discussions that both the men and women participate in....this has been a rewarding experience for us to hear others with issues similar to what we have faced....we are in a 75000 population community in the state of Arkansas . The Arkansas Prostate Cancer Foundation sponsors these meetings all over our state.....btw, I am 14 weeks post DaVinci surgery.

Posts.Title: Frustrated

Posts.Content: I was told by my surgeon to get back on the 5 mg Cialis at 5 weeks. At the same time he put me on Imipramine for improving leakage that was still occurring...... it appears it virtually killed anything the Cialis was intended to be improving, so I'm still in the middle of a long winters nap related to what this post is all about....I'm in my 14th week now and finally off the Imipramine which did help considerably the leakage issue; now virtually dry. After about another week of getting it out of my system, I'll be trying the Cialis once again.....don't want to waste anymore Cialis until the time is right since that stuff has a big price tag.....looking forward to that time even if it comes with some pain.

Posts.Content: New to the forum and 26 days post robotic prostate surgery.....learning to have patience is difficult when things seem to be going good....will have first follow-up visit with surgeon on the 17th and probably first post PSA test. History: Age: 67 Had been doing annual DRE for 22 years with PSA's PSA: 2.41(1-4-12); 3.55(1-9-13); 4.6(9-3-13); 4.06(1-30-14); 3.4(4-30-14); 3.7(7-30-14) Biopsies: 8-26-14.....4 of 17 cores positive....2-5%....2-10% Gleason's score...3+3=6 Surgery....11-13-14....Baptist Medical Center...North Little Rock AR.....Dr. Ronald Kuhn......experience, 2000+ robotics performed. Catheter out on 6th day.....leakage still moderate with 4-5 Depends per day. Pathology report following surgery shows everything was contained within the prostate gland and Gleason's score remained 3+3=6. Proud I chose the surgery route....getting very anxious to get that first PSA test results....hopefully I will find myself on the other side with a ZERO.

Posts.Content: Hours away from first follow-up visit with surgeon.....tomorrow(Wednesday), 1:50 PM.....will be 5 weeks, Thursday, on the other side of robotic prostatectomy.

Posts.Title: Leakage help

Posts.Content: I'm still having moderate leakage following 5 weeks post-robotic prostatectomy....at my follow-up visit on Wednesday my surgeon had me begin a drug called Imipram HCL 25 mg....it is actually an anti-depressant drug but has a feature about it that strengthens the bladder and sphincter muscles....start with 1 at bedtime for a week, 2 at bedtime the 2nd week, and 3 at bedtime the 3rd week and then continue there until you are ready to come off the drug.....we'll hopefully see good results in a few weeks....does anyone have any experience with this approach to leakage??....just had not seen any thread on this forum dealing with this drug.

Posts.Title: Leakage help

Posts.Content: 5 weeks tomorrow on the other side of robotic prostatectomy....but today was the day I had waited for....had my first follow-up visit with urology surgeon...reviewed the pathology report and it was filled with the word "negative".....and, that's music to my ears!!!! All cancer was contained in the gland.....PSA blood test drawn and will know it's results in 3-4 days....surgeon feels we should see that "Zero"....Hopefully will be able to report in a few days that news.

Posts.Title: Concerned about delaying surgery

Posts.Content: I've never seen much discussion on this on this forum but my surgeon placed me on an anti-depressant called Imipramine at 5 weeks....It's known to be used for strengthening bladder/sphincter muscles as to why he wanted me on it, not for depression.....this drug is used with children who have a problem of bed wetting. When I was placed on it I was still needing maybe 4-5 Depends per day. I stayed on it for 7 weeks. When I came off it I was only needing about 1 pad per day and I am now 14 weeks post DaVinci and still using about 1 pad per day....only leakage comes with exertion, stretching, lifting, bending. There are some side effects with the drug that I experienced but I do feel it was beneficial to my leakage.

Posts.Title: Incontinence Exp

Posts.Content: Just so you know, there is another alternative.......I had my biopsies done at the hospital on a day that the urologist had other surgeries....was put to sleep and knew nothing until it was all over......woke up and went home.....never knew anything had been done to me.

Posts.Title: biopsy

Posts.Content: My results was about what you experienced.....bought one, didn't spend a lot of money just so I could try one.....then found out thru my surgeons clinic that they had them and possibly could get it approved thru Medicare....and a much better unit than the one I had bought....we are in the middle of that process now...don't know if approval will come or not....understand there have been some changes since the first of the year with Medicare approving the VED....hoping for better results with the Medicare approved one if it happens....btw, I'm at 14 weeks post DaVinci surgery.

Posts.Title: Vacuum Pumps

Posts.Content: Just completed 12 weeks post-DaVinci surgery and another follow-up with my surgeon.......had gotten 0.00 on PSA at 5 weeks...got a 0.00 PSA at 12 weeks...had been placed on Imipramine at 5 weeks to help improve leakage.....after 7 weeks he's bringing me off of it....side effects are bearable but not very pleasant....will start Cialis 5mg in 2 weeks after the Imipramine gets out of my system.....leakage is probably around 95% dry so with continued kegel exercises, it's getting very manageable, 1 pad per day.......overall a good visit...pleased where I'm at following 12 weeks on the other side....wouldn't have done it any other way!!!!
Posts.Signature: Lloyd History: Age: 67 at time of surgery Had been doing annual DRE for 22 years with PSA's PSA: 2.41(1-4-12); 3.55(1-9-13); 4.6(9-3-13); 4.06(1-30-14); 3.4(4-30-14); 3.7(7-30-14) Biopsies: 8-26-14.....4 of 17 cores [email protected]%[email protected]% Gleason's score...3+3=6 Surgery....11-13-14....Baptist Medical Center...North Little Rock AR.....Dr. Ronald Kuhn......experience, 2000+ robotics performed. Catheter out on 6th day.....leakage still moderate with 4-5 Depends per day. Pathology report following surgery shows everything was contained within the prostate gland and Gleason's score remained 3+3=6. First PSA at 5 weeks post-surgery was 0.00......PSA at 12 weeks was 0.00....PSA at 6 months was 0.00 12 weeks----leakage better....down to most days being 1 pad.....most leakage with increase in activity but manageable.
Posts.Title: Still hearing sweet music to my ears!

Posts.Content: Yeah, same for me.....had the umbilical hernia as well.......surgeon said it would not be a problem....one of his probes for the robotic surgery passes right thru that area near the navel....during my surgery on Nov 13, 2014, he did the prostate and then on the way out he cut out and removed the hernia....he did not use mesh as in most hernia surgeries but pulled me back together and stitched and glued....I have a scar about 1 1/2 inches in length just along the side of my navel but I have a navel again...something I hadn't seen in quite a few years....had to be careful for about 10 weeks with a 10 pound lifting limit placed on me....still very cautious about straining or lifting.

Posts.Title: Herniated navel complications during surgery

Posts.Content: I know there has been occasional references in threads to this idea of shrinkage following the DaVinci robotic procedure.....just wondering what help might be out there. I'm not referring to ED issues, erections, using Cialis or Viagra but simply has anyone found any significant help in improving this thing of shrinkage...I've used the vacuum pumps for exercising the blood vessels but it doesn't take long for it to return to it's comfortable state. I see supplements that are advertised thru GNC stores and similar health stores....does anyone try these products and achieve any results.......Just trying to find this little guy some help.

Catheter out on 6th day.....leakage still moderate with 4-5 Depends per day. Pathology report following surgery shows everything was contained within the prostate gland and Gleason's score remained 3+3=6. First PSA at 5 weeks post-surgery was 0.00......PSA at 12 weeks was 0.00....PSA at 6 months was 0.00 12 weeks----leakage better....down to most days being 1 pad.....most leakage with increase in activity but manageable.
Posts.Title: Shrinkage following DaVinci

Posts.Content: I've never seen much discussion on this on this forum but my surgeon placed me on an anti-depressant called Imipramine at 5 weeks....It's known to be used for strengthening bladder/sphincter muscles as to why he wanted me on it, not for depression.....this drug is used with children who have a problem of bed wetting. When I was placed on it I was still needing maybe 4-5 Depends per day. I stayed on it for 7 weeks. When I came off it I was only needing about 1 pad per day and I am now 14 weeks post DaVinci and still using about 1 pad per day....only leakage comes with exertion, stretching, lifting, bending. There are some side effects with the drug that I experienced but I do feel it was beneficial to my leakage.

Posts.Title: Shrinkage following DaVinci

Posts.Content: Don't let PSA readings lead you astray......For one year prior to having biopsies I had PSA's every 3 months....ranged in order 4.6, 4.06, 3.4, and then 26 days before biopsies 3.7.....only in the last exam and DRE did the urologist suspect something ....one does not have to have high readings.....4 out of 17 biopsies were [email protected]% and [email protected]% .....but as others have said...probably no need to rush.

Posts.Title: Concerned Partner

Posts.Content: I don't follow your thought process.....you posted this thread at 11:42 this morning and it's had 97 views........my first thread was posted and in 48 hours it gathered 278 views!!!!!Maybe I don't know what to look for but that got my attention very quickly that I was where I wanted to be!!!!.....And I can't even begin to put a mark on the VALUABLE ADVICE I've received though I maybe didn't comment I certainly was reading and soaking that advice in. I've only been viewing and participating since mid-but in the 14 weeks since DaVinci surgery....It's been a site that has helped me along this highway of dealing with PC......it gives me valuable questions to ask my surgeon each time I do my follow-ups.

Posts.Title: Question

Posts.Content: Had the same experience as the others have mentioned for a few weeks following DaVinci.....came mainly after events that took a little more exertion of energy or strain.....never had anything dark but enough you could easily tell it was there.....think it's pretty common with most.
